quote: A state that does not educate and train women is like a man who only trains his right arm.
author: Jostein Gaarder

quote: It is very nearly impossible to become an educated person in a country so distrustful of the independent mind.
author: James     Baldwin

quote: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Education is the power to think clearly, the power to act well in the world's work, and the power to appreciate life.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
author: H.G. Wells

quote: Teaching is not a lost art, but the regard for it is a lost tradition.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: Ignorance is the parent of fear.
author: Herman Melville

quote: When you take the free will out of education, that turns it into schooling.
author: John Taylor Gatto

quote: What we become depends on what we read after all of the professors have finished with us. The greatest university of all is a collection of books.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.
author: Harry Truman

quote: Only the educated are free.
author: Epictetus

quote: [Myrnin to Claire about their costumes of Pierrot and Harlequin, respectively]"Don't they teach you anything in your sch
author: Rachel Caine

quote: Often, a school is your best bet-perhaps not for education but certainly for protection from an undead attack.
author: Max Brooks

quote: You can't stop a teacher when they want to do something. They just do it.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: Thank goodness I was never sent to school it would have rubbed off some of the originality.
author: Beatrix Potter

quote: What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education.
author: Harold Howe

quote: You'll never know everything about anything, especially something you love.
author: Julia Child

quote: A man will be imprisoned in a room with a door that's unlocked and opens inwards as long as it does not occur to him to pull rather than push.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: A learned fool is more a fool than an ignorant fool.
author: Molière

quote: The only things you learn are the things you tame
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Real education must ultimately be limited to men who insist on knowing. The rest is mere sheep herding.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing
author: Warren Buffett

quote: A woman with an education may be able to spend more time sitting in a chair instead of lying on her back. A sound advantage, I should think.
author: Anne Bishop

quote: The purpose of education is not to validate ignorance but to overcome it
author: Lawrence M. Krauss

quote: There will be no mass-based feminist movement as long as feminist ideas are understood only by a well-educated few.
author: bell hooks

quote: I read my eyes out and can't read half enough...the more one reads the more one sees we have to read.
author: John  Adams

quote: There are few things more pathetic than those who have lost their curiosity and sense of adventure, and who no longer care to learn.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: A teacher who loves learning earns the right and the ability to help others learn.
author: Ruth Beechick

quote: Everything can be explained to the people, on the single condition that you want them to understand.
author: Frantz Fanon

quote: The secret of education lies in respecting the pupil.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: To educate the peasantry, three things are needed: schools, schools and schools.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Public education was not founded to give society what it wants. Quite the opposite.
author: May Sarton

quote: It's what we think we know that keeps us from learning.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: We must be careful not to discourage our twelve-year-olds by making them waste the best years of their lives preparing for examinations.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: You never really learn much from hearing yourself speak.
author: George Clooney

quote: Education is a progressive discovery of our own ignorance.
author: Will Durant

quote: All of life is a constant education.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Education, n. That which discloses to the wise and disguises from the foolish their lack of understanding.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: It is clearly absurd to limit the term 'education' to a person's formal schooling.
author: Murray N. Rothbard

quote: It is the mark of a truly educated man to know what not to read.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: School prepares you for the real world... which also bites.
author: Jim Benton

quote: [Homeschooling]...recipe for genius: More of family and less of school, more of parents and less of peers, more creative freedom and less formal lessons.
author: Raymond S. Moore

quote: It doesn`t hurt to get more education.
author: Donald J. Trump

quote: A wise parent humors the desire for independent action, so as to become the friend and advisor when his absolute rule shall cease.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell

quote: Every mountain top is within reach if you just keep climbing.
author: Barry Finlay

quote: The aim of totalitarian education has never been to instill convictions but to destroy the capacity to form any.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: The purpose of education is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Education...has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.
author: George Macaulay Trevelyan

quote: I am always ready to learn although I do not always like being taught.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Learning is not cumpulsory... neither is survival.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Art is a process, not a product.
author: MaryAnn F. Kohl

quote: The problem is not the content of textbooks, but the very idea of them.
author: Sam Wineburg

quote: Power-lust is a weed that grows only in the vacant lots of an abandoned mind.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: My education was the liberty I had to read indiscriminately and all the time, with my eyes hanging out.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Education is a weapon, whose effect depends on who holds it in his hands and at whom it is aimed.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: You didn't need a college degree to become one of the people who knew what was really going on. If you paid attention, you could pick things up on your own.
author: Jeannette Walls

quote: Education is the process of selling someone on books.
author: Douglas Wilson

quote: They're so cold, these scholars!May lightning strike their foodso that their mouths learn howto eat fire!
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: It is always a much easier task to educate uneducated people than to re-educate the mis-educated.
author: Herbert M. Shelton

quote: Teaching kids how to feed themselves and how to live in a community responsibly is the center of an education.
author: Alice Waters

quote: Education is the manifestation of perfection already existing in man.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: In the times of trouble, be like the strong wall. In the times of joy, be like the smiling sun.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: It is a thousand times better to have common sense without education than to have education without common sense.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: nothing contributes so much to tranquilize the mind as a steady purpose
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: When you study great teachers... you will learn much more from their caring and hard work than from their style.
author: William Glasser

quote: In the little world in which children have their existence, whosoever brings them up, there is nothing so finely perceived and so finely felt as injustice.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The learning process is something you can incite, literally incite, like a riot.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: Those who trust us educate us.
author: George Eliot

quote: The home environment can undo a lot you try to do at school.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Throwing herself into learning helped Miri ignore the painful chill of solitude around her.
author: Shannon Hale

quote: A fourth-grade reader may be a sixth-grade mathematician. The grade is an administrative device which does violence to the nature of the developmental process.
author: B.F. Skinner

quote: Twelve-year-olds are eager to turn everything into arguments but don't have the cognitive skills to win them.
author: Linda Perlstein

quote: The education of all children, from the moment that they can get along without a mother's care, shall be in state institutions.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: To know how to suggest is the art of teaching.
author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

quote: Someday, I hope that we will all be patriots of our planet and not just of our respective nations.
author: Zoe Weil

quote: As you can see, there are quite a number of things taught in school that one has to unlearn or at least correct.
author: Ambeth R. Ocampo

quote: My mum and dad had worked incredibly hard to afford me an education.
author: Benedict Cumberbatch

quote: Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: School is the advertising agency which makes you believe that you need the society as it is.
author: Ivan Illich

quote: What is the most important thing one learns in school? Self-esteem, support, and friendship.
author: Terry Tempest Williams

quote: If you teach a boy, you educate an individual; but if you teach a girl, you educate a community.
author: Greg Mortenson

quote: Spend the years of learning squanderingCourage for the years of wanderingThrough a world politely turningFrom the loutishness of learning.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Our children are only as brilliant as we allow them to be.
author: Eric Micha'el Leventhal

quote: If you consider a woman less pure after you’ve touched hermaybe you should take a looks at your hands.
author: Kaija Sabbah

quote: Teachers are the one and only people who save nations.
author: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk

quote: True education does not consist merely in the acquiring of a few facts of science, history, literature, or art, but in the development of character.
author: David O. McKay

quote: Education: the inculcation of the incomprehensible into the indifferent by the incompetent.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: The whole purpose of education is to turn mirrors into windows.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: When you wage war on the public schools, you're attacking the mortar that holds the community together. You're not a conservative, you're a vandal.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: Education isn't for getting a job. It's about developing yourself as a human being.
author: Liz Berry

quote: I used my history degree about twice a year whether I needed to or not.
author: Patricia Briggs

quote: Ignorance is ultimately the worst enemy of a people who want to be free.
author: Jonathan Hennessey

quote: A lecture has been well described as the process whereby the notes of the teacher become the notes of the student without passing through the mind of either.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

quote: All that I've learned, I've forgotten. The little that I still know, I've guessed.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

quote: One of these grand defects, as I humbly conceive, is this, that children are habituated to learning without understanding.
author: Jonathan Edwards

quote: A child's education should begin at least 100 years before he was born.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quote: The great aim of education is not knowledge but action.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: No school can supply an anti-liberal education, or a fascist education, as these terms are contradictory. Liberalism and education are one.
author: George Seldes

quote: Night clubs are where Americans learn the laws of motion.
author: Bauvard

quote: All of us must cross the line between ignorance and insight many times before we truly understand.
author: David  Hawkins

quote: Whenever you read a good book, somewhere in the world a door opens to allow in more light.
author: Vera Nazarian

quote: Intelligence and education that hasn't been tempered by human affection isn't worth a damn.
author: Daniel Keyes

quote: Education does not mean teaching people what they do not know. It means teaching them to behave as they do not behave.
author: John Ruskin

quote: One of the penalties of an ecological education is that one lives alone in a world of wounds.
author: Aldo Leopold

quote: Don't try to make children grow up to be like you, or they may do it.
author: Russell Baker

quote: There are only three ways to teach a child. The first is by example, the second is by example, the third is by example.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Admission of ignorance is often the first step in our education.
author: Stephen R. Covey

quote: Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to solve.
author: Roger Lewin

quote: Education is the movement from darkness to light.
author: Allan Bloom

quote: When mother-cow is chewing grass its young ones watch its mouth
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: Most often people seek in life occasions for persisting in their opinions rather than for educating themselves.
author: André Gide

quote: A PHD is not the end of education. Education exists even among the bees who feed their queen only with the purest
author: Sahndra Fon Dufe

quote: In the end, it's not what we keep our children from that will save them. It's what we put into them in the first place.
author: Marc Parent

quote: It was much more than bricks and stone - It was an idea.
author: Patricia C. McKissack

quote: Self-education is the only possible education the rest is mere veneer laid on the surface of a child's nature.
author: Charlotte M. Mason

quote: To reap a return in ten years, plant trees. To reap a return in 100, cultivate the people.
author: Hồ Chí Minh

quote: Education leads to enlightenment. Enlightenment opens the way to empathy. Empathy foreshadows reform.
author: Derrick A. Bell

quote: The home is the chief school of human virtues.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Prison for the crime of puberty -- that was how secondary school had seemed.
author: David Brin

quote: Ask yourself: 'Do I feel the need to laminate?' Then teaching is for you.
author: Gordon Korman

quote: Whoever educates himself and improves his own morals & character is superior to the man who tries to teach & train others.
author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib

quote: You can't learn everything you need to know legally.
author: John Irving

quote: I am not simply teaching the reading I am teaching the reader.
author: Kelly Gallagher

quote: [T]he great end of education . . . is to persuade and to inspire the sincere love of virtue.
author: George Turnbull

quote: Instead of making prisoners out of our students, we ought to make students out of our prisoners.
author: Paul W. Silver

quote: Any formal attack on ignorance is bound to fail because the masses are always ready to defend their most precious possession - their ignorance.
author: Hendrik Willem van Loon

quote: The chief wonder of education is that it does not ruin everybody concerned in it, teachers and taught.
author: Henry Adams

quote: [T]eaching has been for me an education (Lord knows what it has been for my students).
author: Howard Nemerov

quote: Like many highly educated people, I didn't have much in the way of actual skills.
author: J. Maarten Troost

quote: I was taught that I had to 'master' subjects. But who can 'master' beauty, or peace, or joy?
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: How is there freedom to choose if one does not learn how to choose?
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: The best book is not one that informs merely, but one that stirs the reader up to inform himself.
author: A.W. Tozer

quote: Mental acuity of any kind comes from solving problems yourself, not from being told how to solve them.
author: Paul  Lockhart

quote: A library is a place where you learn what teachers were afraid to teach you.
author: Alan M. Dershowitz

quote: Hey, Geekoid!" yelled Duncan Dougal, "Why do you read so much? Don't you know how to watch TV?
author: Bruce Coville

quote: In sum, then, "thinking about thinking" has to be a principal ingredient of any empowering practice of education.
author: Jerome Bruner

quote: Much education today is monumentally ineffective. All too often we are giving young people cut flowers when we should be teaching them to grow their own plants.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: An educated mind is a questioning mind. Or is it?
author: T.S. Welti

quote: Under her high brows, she eyed him straight on and straight across. She had gone to girls' schools, he recalled later. Those girls looked straight at you.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: Learning is by nature curiosity... prying into everything, reluctant to leave anything, material or immaterial, unexplained.
author: Philo of Alexandria

quote: You can't teach calculus to a chimpanzee. So just share your banana.
author: John Rachel

quote: Most doctors are prisoners of their education and shackled by their profession.
author: Richard Diaz

quote: The purpose of education is to save young people from the paralyzing effects of wealth and poverty. (more or less verbatim quote)
author: Kurt Hahn

quote: For the ancient Greeks, the ultimate test of the educational system was the moral and political quality of the students that it produced
author: Henry A. Giroux

quote: The working class had imposed upon them a sterile and authoritarian educational system which mirrored the ethos of the corporate workplace.
author: Anthony M. Platt

quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
author: Diogenes of Sinope

quote: The best education consists in immunizing people against systematic attempts at education.
author: Paul Karl Feyerabend

quote: The purpose of school should not be to prepare students for more school. We should be seeking to have fully engaged students now.
author: Donalyn Miller

quote: Education is the preparation of a child intellectually, emotionally, spiritually, and physically for life and for eternity.
author: Kevin Swanson

quote: Some people drink deeply from the fountain of knowledge. Others just gargle.
author: Grant M. Bright

quote: In the conditions of modern life the rule is absolute, the race which does not value trained intelligence is doomed.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: We get schooled by the people around us, and it stays inside us deep.
author: George Pelecanos

quote: I think it's hard to learn democracy when we make children prisoners until they're nineteen years old.
author: Mimsy Sadofsky

quote: The humanities should constitute the core of any university worth the name.
author: Terry Eagleton

quote: Who said to kill does not require gentleness?
author: Nawal El-Saadawi

quote: You will not reap the fruit of individuality in your children if you clone their education.
author: Marilyn Howshall

quote: Some men never recover from education.
author: Oliver St. John Gogarty

quote: The quality of the relationships that students have in class with their peers and teachers is important to their success in school.
author: Bob Pletka

quote: I also did some jail time a few years ago. Spent a whole summer in jail reading books. I pumped a ton of new knowledge and new thinking into myself.
author: Tommy Lee

quote: Wine can be a better teacher than ink, and banter is often better than books
author: Stephen Fry

quote: ...primarily the individual is going to study at home.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: He worked with her as she was and not as he wanted her to be.
author: Colin Clark

quote: I may not have a degree, but I certainly got an education.
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: Experience is the opposite of education.
author: Ashly Lorenzana

quote: You musn't neglect your education in favor of your studies.
author: Nick O'Donohoe

quote: Education is a lifetime assignment & terminates when you do.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: What all good teachers have in common, however, is that they set high standards for their students and do not settle for anything less.
author: Marva Collins

quote: Education becomes most rich and alive when it confronts the reality of moral conflict in the world.
author: Howard Zinn

quote: When the atmosphere encourages learning, the learning is inevitable.
author: Elizabeth Foss

quote: If you've had the right kind of education, it's amazing how many things you can find to feel guilty about.
author: Pete McCarthy

quote: In order to fix it, you need a passionate anger about something that doesn't work well.
author: James Dyson

quote: Your life can be different, Young Ju. Study and be strong. In America, women have choices.
author: An Na

quote: Sometimes, the way around prejudice is education.
author: Liza Mundy

quote: Respect is tendered with pleasure only where it is not exacted.
author: Anne-Robert-Jacques Turgot

quote: Improving intelligence is possible, but it is more likely to occur if children are given the right experiences at the right ages.
author: Dennis Garlick

quote: People are afraid of being more ignorant than their children―especially, apparantly, their daughters.
author: Daniel C. Dennett

quote: Not with whom you are born, but with whom you are bred.
author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quote: Nations, as well as men, almost always betray the most prominent features of their future destiny in their earliest years.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Jack Woodson is currently living and working in Dallas, TX. He has forty children, and all of them have different mothers.
author: John  Pearson

quote: Hey there, Hallie, welcome to the next place we need a Deer Crossing sign.' I didn't know that deers could
author: Laura Pedersen

quote: If doctors are paid the same salary as bus drivers, community would not be crazy about making their children doctors
author: Nouman Ali Khan

quote: Real education should educate us out of self into something far finer into a selflessness which links us with all humanity.
author: Nancy Astor the Viscountess Astor

quote: In trying to justify the humanities, as in trying to live a life, what may turn out to matter most is holding one's nerve.
author: Stefan Collini

quote: We study biology, physics, movements of glaciers... Where are the classes on envy, feeling wronged, despair, bitterness...
author: Alain de Botton

quote: You learn almost as much about a thinker from what he reads—in particular, what he likes and what he disdains—as from what he writes himself.
author: Rodney Ulyate

quote: In so many ways we are still in the dark ages, but there is light appearing over the horizon of choice and consciousness.
author: Bryant McGill

quote: First step is to read and write but the major Education start when we are able to translate and tranform on everything we reads, get contact and spoken of.
author: Olawale Robyns

quote: We can’t build a nation by keeping the teachers hungry.
author: M.F. Moonzajer

quote: A good education helps us make sense of the world and find our way in it
author: Mike Rose

quote: If you’ve got a dozen pitchers, you need to speak 12 different languages.
author: Michael   Lewis

quote: You go to school everyday. Folks who think they've learned everything they need to know are usually dumber than chickens.
author: Jodi Thomas

quote: Give a man a hoe and he is something to exploit. Give him a book and he is something to fear.
author: Eric Burns

quote: Let failure be your workshop. See it for what is is: the world walking you through a tough but necessary semester, free of tuition. (from Workbook)
author: Steven Heighton

quote: We are in the process of disabling our most distinctive achievement - our educational system - in the name of making the country more like itself.
author: Marilynne Robinson

quote: A tax-supported, compulsory educational system is the complete model of the totalitarian state.
author: Isabel Paterson

quote: Getting an education is an awfully wearing process!
author: Jean Webster

quote: Body and spirit, I surrendered whole, To harsh Instructors- and received a soul.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: education is one thing and instruction, however worthy, necessary and incidentally or monetarily educative, another.
author: Kingsley Amis

quote: Christ is the Lesson as well as the Teacher.
author: Darvin Pruitt

quote: Much of what we call History is the success stories of madmen.
author: John Holt

quote: Congress and state legislatures should not tell teachers how to teach, any more than they should tell surgeons how to perform operations.
author: Diane Ravitch

quote: You have a life make a success of it.
author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha

quote: All situations in which the interrelationships between extremes are involved are the most interesting and instructive.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: Sine doctrina vita est quasi mortis imago" [Without learning, life is but the image of death]
author: Dionysius Cato

quote: Daring to make a difference in today's youth-one page at a time
author: william sawyers

quote: In an age in which the media broadcast countless pieces of foolishness, the educated man is defined not by what he knows, but by what he doesn't know.
author: Nicolás Gómez Dávila

quote: If values are woven into the very concept of education, where is the need for separate value education?
author: Vijaya Bharathy

quote: But little Carlos's most important defense was not his good punch but rather the beginnings of a great education.
author: Gina Capaldi

quote: There is one right thing for the student to do, that is, to develop the habit of weighing worths, of sensing the relative values of the facts that he meets.
author: Frank Morton McMurry

quote: But artists didn't need to achieve "firsts", and Hughes wanted to be an artist.
author: Diane Wood Middlebrook

quote: Trying to get more learning out of the present system is like trying to get the Pony Express to compete with the telegraph by breeding faster ponies.
author: Edward Fiske

quote: Welcome to Hartford. The poorest city in the wealthiest state in the richest country on earth.
author: Susan Eaton

quote: Criticism talks a good deal of nonsense, but even its nonsense is a useful force. It keeps the question of art before the world, insists upon its importance.
author: Henry James

quote: Music and symbols, they're older than human race.Prehuman beings used them to teach early mankind.
author: Toba Beta

quote: Education is what remains when we have forgotten all that we have been taught.
author: George Savile Halifax

quote: If knowledge is not democratized, power can never be.
author: Steven Rose

quote: Still reading but learning a lot about true education and the process of guiding our children in their educational pursuits.
author: Oliver DeMille

quote: Step into the light and create your own shadow.
author: r. A. bentinck

quote: If You want to be an educated person follow nobody, but learn from everybody
author: Jan Jansen Easy Branches

quote: When the true history fades, ask education and the unbiased story tellers
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

quote: If we do not fix education in Africa, we are heading for monumental economic disaster.
author: Mmanti Umoh

quote: Not everyone in school is learning. Not everyone learning is in school
author: Saji Ijiyemi

quote: Cleaning and breathing rival the practice of gardening or reading in their passive difficulty.
author: Mark Sherman Smeester

quote: In chaos is where learning happens the most.
author: Tarun Sharma

quote: Solution to every long term problem is education.Solution to every short term problem is a smile.
author: Mahrukh

quote: We do many things carelessly or unwillingly, but nothing studiously unless we are willing and apply ourselves.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: I do not consider my deeds or my knowledge to be a great thing. The only fact is — and I can say this honestly — that I love learning and a solitary life.
author: Christine de Pizan

quote: In this day and age, nobody can learn more than a sliver of all there is to know. Why force everyone to learn the same sliver?
author: Peter Gray

quote: It is impossible for an uneducated man to rebel.
author: Paul Bamikole

quote: Speaking is like conducting an orchestra; but instead of music, you are directing emotions.
author: Anthony Eldridge Rogers

quote: An uncorked kid to me is an expression as to who they truly are and isn't it that that as adults we strive to achieve throughout our whole lives?
author: Lehla Eldridge

quote: But what good is it to teach a child to count, if you don't show him that he counts for something?
author: Chris Cleave

quote: There is far, far more to being human than any of us can become on our own.
author: Ronald R.  Johnson

quote: But if I'm useless only because I haven't been properly educated, is that my fault?
author: Richard Aldington

quote: Mundane education is regrettably prosaic," - Jace Lightwood-Herondale
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: True. The school admin decided that a girls clothes were more important than her education.
author: Svetlana Chmakova

quote: Always choose the most difficult way, there you will not meet competitors.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: But as we all know, rock ‘n’ roll will never die, and education too, as Henry Adams always sez, keeps going on forever.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: The one thing no one can ever take from you is your education…
author: Nanette L. Avery

quote: We have to embrace the values of morality and proper education in order to gain respect from the majority of the people who dwell in our community.
author: Saaif Alam

quote: Fire . . . Does that light by itself?
author: Tsukumizu

quote: Life is always just to learn.
author: Will Advise

quote: For the sole true end of education is simply this: to teach men how to learn for themselves and whatever instruction fails to do this is effort spent in vain.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Doctors of ancient times used to recommend reading to their patients as a physical exercise on an equal level as walking, running, or ball-playing.
author: Jean Leclercq

quote: Education is a system designed to make you feel inferior, yet they encourage you to accept it in order to be superior
author: Isiphile Petse

quote: The belief that young people are incapable of making reasonable decisions is a cornerstone of our system of compulsory, closely monitored education.
author: Peter O. Gray

quote: The test of successful education is not the amount of knowledge that pupils take away from school, but their appetite to know and their capacity to learn.
author: Richard Livingstone

quote: We need both Socrates and Aristotle in the search for knowledge, but in education today there is too much Aristotle and too little Socrates.
author: Gregory J.E. Rawlins

quote: For me, education—both teaching and learning—is about building relationships and developing rapport with students, with parents, and with faculty.
author: Carlos Heleno

quote: Successful teaching rests both on a genuine and selfless concern for students and on the ability to convey to them a love of history.
author: Eric Foner

quote: Those who looked with revulsion at the oppressive might of her arms, were obliged to marvel at the egalitarian nature of her social programmes.
author: A.H. Septimius

quote: Pain and suffering have been my most trusted textbook.
author: Bert McCoy

quote: Don’t wait for the tornado, struggles make you reach the castle.
author: Basheer Amiri
